item.title: Prediction-Realization Diagram
item.description: The function plotPRD of the forvision package plots the Prediction-Realization Diagram for the given data from dataset containing columns actual, forecast, and method (AFTS). Here’s a prediction-realization diagram created by the function plotPRD: library(forvision) plotPRD(AFTS) The resulting prediction-relization digram plotted in logarithmic scales by using the option setting useLog ==TRUE: library(forvision) plotPRD(AFTS, useLogs = TRUE) The prediction-realization diagram for the selected methods: # For the methods "ARARMA", "Auto-ANN", and "DAMPEN" data1 <- subset(AFTS, method == c("ARARMA", "Auto-ANN", "DAMPEN")) library(forvision) plotPRD(data1) The prediction-realization diagram for the selected horizon:

item.title: Fanchart
item.description: The function plot_fs of the forvision package plots the fanchart for the given data from dataset containing 2 dataframes TSTS and AFTS. Here’s a fanchart created by the function plot_fs for time series of id == “M1”: library(forvision) plot_fs(ts = TSTS1, fc = AFTS1, id = "M1") The fanchart with the forecasts of the single forecast method by using the option setting method: library(forvision) plot_fs(ts = TSTS1, fc = AFTS1, id = "M1", method = "AutoBox1") The fanchart with the forecasts of the multiple forecast methods by using the option setting method:
